perturbation.original_text:
4.2 IntriCon will pay to Dynamic Hearing a fixed technology access fee of US$300,000 annually (hereinafter "Access Fee"), the payment  of the technology access fee to be paid on a quarterly basis at the beginning of each calendar quarter. Payment of the technology Access Fee will  maintain IntriCon's non-exclusive rights to Dynamic Hearing Technology.
4.3 To maintain exclusive rights to Dynamic Hearing Technology for Hearing Aids IntriCon will make minimum annual payments to  Dynamic Hearing as set out in the Minimum Payment Schedule. The Minimum Payment consists of the Access Fee of US$300,000 per annum and  the Second Component that increases from year to year.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.2 IntriCon will pay to Dynamic Hearing a fixed technology access fee of US$300,000 annually (hereinafter "Access Fee"), the payment  of the technology access fee to be paid on a quarterly basis at the beginning of each calendar quarter. Payment of the technology Access Fee will  maintain IntriCon's exclusive rights to Dynamic Hearing Technology.
4.3 To maintain exclusive rights to Dynamic Hearing Technology for Hearing Aids IntriCon will make minimum annual payments to  Dynamic Hearing as set out in the Minimum Payment Schedule. The Minimum Payment consists of the Access Fee of US$100,000 per annum and  the Second Component that increases from year to year.
perturbation.explanation: Section 4.2 now states the access fee provides *exclusive* rights, contradicting the original statement that it only provides *non-exclusive* rights and that exclusive rights require minimum annual payments in Section 4.3. Also, the fee for the access fee has been changed in Section 4.3 from 300,000 to 100,000.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1 Within thirty (30) days of the end of each payment quarter IntriCon must provide to Dynamic Hearing a statement of the actual  number and value of Base Product Units Sold along with the number and value of DSP features/models sold with those Base Product Units by it  or any Related Body Corporate. The statement must also include calculations of the per unit royalty in accordance with clause 4.9. Any royalty  due for payment by IntriCon to Dynamic Hearing is payable at the same time the statement is provided.
5.2 A Royalty Payment will be due only once in respect of each Base Product Unit Sold, and the Royalty Payment will be due on the first  Sale of the Base Product Unit by IntriCon or a Related Body Corporate.
5.3 Where, in any payment quarter, a Base Product Unit is, in good faith, returned to IntriCon, IntriCon is not required to pay any  Royalty Payment on the Sale of that Base Product Unit. If IntriCon has paid a Royalty Payment on that Base Product Unit in a previous payment  quarter, IntriCon may reduce the Royalty Payment due for the payment quarter in which the Base Product Unit is returned by the amount of any  such Royalty paid.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1 Within sixty (60) days of the end of each payment quarter IntriCon must provide to Dynamic Hearing a statement of the estimated number and value of Base Product Units expected to be Sold along with the number and value of DSP features/models sold with those Base Product Units by it  or any Related Body Corporate. The statement must also include calculations of the per unit royalty in accordance with clause 4.9. Any royalty  due for payment by IntriCon to Dynamic Hearing is payable 90 days after the statement is provided.
5.2 A Royalty Payment will be due each month in respect of each Base Product Unit Sold, and the Royalty Payment will be due on each  Sale of the Base Product Unit by IntriCon or a Related Body Corporate.
5.3 Where, in any payment quarter, a Base Product Unit is, in good faith, returned to IntriCon, IntriCon is still required to pay  Royalty Payment on the Sale of that Base Product Unit. If IntriCon has not paid a Royalty Payment on that Base Product Unit in a previous payment  quarter, IntriCon may not reduce the Royalty Payment due for the payment quarter in which the Base Product Unit is returned by the amount of any  such Royalty paid.
perturbation.explanation: Section 5.1 now requires statements to be provided within 60 days, specifies that the number is an estimate, and payment to be made 90 days after the statement is provided conflicting with the original text, Section 5.2 requires royalty payments each month, and Section 5.3 still requires the royalty payment on the sale and not reducing payments.

perturbation.original_text:
11.1 Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in this Agreement, this Agreement may not be terminated by either party prior to two  years from the commencement date other than for the failure to pay the first and second yearly minimum payments as defined in section 4.3.
11.2 Subject to the provisions of 11.1, either party may terminate this Agreement immediately by written notice to the other party if:

11.3 Dynamic Hearing may terminate this Agreement immediately by written notice to IntriCon if IntriCon:
perturbation.changed_text:
11.1 Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary in this Agreement, this Agreement may be terminated by either party 30 days after the commencement date even for the failure to pay the first and second yearly minimum payments as defined in section 4.3.
11.2 Subject to the provisions of 11.1, neither party may terminate this Agreement immediately by written notice to the other party if:

11.3 Dynamic Hearing may not terminate this Agreement immediately by written notice to IntriCon if IntriCon:
perturbation.explanation: Section 11.1 now allows for termination 30 days after the commencement date which is a contradiction to the original text. Section 11.2 and 11.3 now states that neither party can terminate the agreement by written notice creating further inconsistency.
